required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Beta- Probe and Surgery in GEP NET: Evaluation of a New Probe
clinical_study.official_title: Studio Esplorativo Monocentrico Non Controllato, in Aperto, Volto a Sviluppare e Valutare l'Applicazione di Una Tecnica Innovativa di Rimozione Radioguidata Dei Tumori Neuroendocrini Gastro-entero-pancreatici

brief_summary.textblock:
Radioguided surgery (RGS) with beta- radioisotopes is a novel approach focused on developing a new probe which, detecting electrons and operating with low background, provides a clearer delineation of the margins of lesions with low radiation exposition for surgeons.
To validate this procedure, ex vivo specimens of tumours expressing somatostatin receptors, as small-intestine neuroendocrine (SI-NET), will be tested

detailed_description.textblock:
Small Intestinal neuroendocrine patients, with a positive Ga-68-DOTATOC PET/CT, will receive a small amount of beta- radiopharmaceutical (Y-90-DOTATOC), and then operated, as clinical indicated.
Tissue samples will be tested ex-vivo with a beta-probe prototype

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of sensitivity of a beta- probe
primary_outcome.description: after receiving a small amount of radioactivity, patients will be operated and an evaluation of radioactivity on surgical specimens will be evaluated

arm_group.description: Patients affected by Small Intestine neuroendocrine tumors

intervention.description: Patients enrolled for surgery will receive a small amount of Y-90-DOTATOC, in order to check beta- radioactivity by the probe

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- SI NET patients, Ga-68-DOTATOC PET/CT positive, proposed for surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- negative PET/CT; pregnancy
